feasibility.description: A previous study, evaluation and analysis of the potential of applying gamification or refuse it.

risk.description: A probability or threat of damage, injury, liability, loss, or any other negative occurrence.

investment.description: The benefit to the investor resulting from running a gamified experience.

stakeholders.description: A technique used to identify and keep in mind the people who have to interact with the design process.

engagement_cycle.description: The game mechanics combined with reinforcement and feedback in order to engage the player in the key system actions.

endgame.description: A pre-established end of game or glorious victory in the system, usually stretching players to the limits of their abilities.

onboarding.description: The way of starting the new participants.

rules.description: The body of regulations prescribed by the designer.

metrics.description: The standards of measurement by which efficiency, performance, progress, process or quality.

analytics.description: The algorithms and data used to measure key performance indicators.

ethics.description: A branch of philosophy that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong conducts.

motivation.description: The behaviour which causes a~person to want to repeat an~action and vice-versa.

desired_behaviours.description: The expected response of the players after the interaction.

storytelling.description: The story and context created by designers.

user_experience.description: Refers to everything designed into the gamified system which a player being may interact and the playerâ€™s behaviours, attitudes, and emotions.

technology.description: The use or need of a software component for development.
